text.p: This is how major world bond markets were trading in late European business on Friday.

GERMANY - German Bund future little changed after the release of U.S. jobless claims and durable goods orders. Data was seen as last chance for price swing today. The March Bund future on the London International Financial Futures and Options Exchange (LIFFE) was trading at 100.67, down 0.05 from Tuesday's settlement price.

BRITAIN - Gilt futures ended a half-day's trading on LIFFE just 1/32 higher having meandered in a narrow 9/32 range. Next week will see more traders and investors return to work, looking first to M0 data on Tuesday. The March long gilt future on LIFFE was trading at 110-01/32, up 01/32 from Tuesday's settlement price.

FRANCE - French bonds end significantly higher but on low volumes as gains fuelled by a 1.6 pct drop in U.S. durable goods knock away key resistance in the last 10 minutes of pit trade. The March notional bond future on the MATIF in Paris settled at 129.30 up 0.30 from Tuesday's settlement price.

ITALY - Italian bond futures pared earlier losses to close easier weighed down by the lack of progress on pay talks between metalworkers and employers and as Italian wage inflation rose to 4.5 pct in Nov after Oct's 3.7 pct. Metalworker talks set to restart on Jan 3. Support came from steady lira and rally on T-bonds after U.S. data. The March bond future on LIFFE was trading at 128.25 down 0.05 from Tuesday's settlement price.

UNITED STATES - US Treasuries climb after jobless, Nov orders declines. November durable orders drop 1.6 pct, weaker than expected. Weekly jobless claims fall to 335,000 from rev 350,000 last week, indicating more labor market strength than forecast. Firm dollar gave Treasuries some early support.The March Treasury bond future on the Chicago Board of Trade was trading at 113-26/32, up 15/32 from Tuesday's settlement price. The long bond was quoted to yield 6.55 percent.

JAPAN - Japanese government bond futures end sharply lower as investors sell cash JGBs and non-JGB issues to realise profits. Sentiment bearish with market players watching yen and Tokyo stocks for clues to direction.In after hours trading the March future on LIFFE was trading at 124.41, down 0.63 from Tuesday's settlement price on the Tokyo Stock Exchange.
